A datapoint usually fails to upload when using a deferred upload mechanism such as when providing a URL
and the URL is not accessible.

parameters.description: The id of the order

Returns the aggregated result as a file with a given name.

post.summary: Clones an existing order.
post.description: In order to clone an order, the existing order must be marked as public.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to clone

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.summary: Unlocks a newly cloned order.
post.description:
When an order is cloned only the necessary information is copied.
In order to make changes to the order, it must be unlocked first.
Unlocking the order will clone the entire dataset and its datapoints.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to unlock

patch.summary: Updates whether an order is a demo or not.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

parameters.name: isDemo
parameters.description: Whether to mark or unmark the order as a demo

patch.summary: Updates whether an order is public or not.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

parameters.name: isPublic
parameters.description: Whether to mark or unmark the order as public

post.summary: Submits an order for approval.
post.description:
Once an order is created its order id and dataset id is returned.
The dataset id can be used to fill the dataset with data points.
Once submitted, the order will be locked and no further changes can be made.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the submission.

post.summary: Approves an order that has been submitted for manual approval.
post.description:
An order is submitted for manual approval when the automatic approval process could not automatically
determine if the order is safe to process.
Once an order is approved, the pipeline will start processing the order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to approve

patch.summary: Updates the name of an order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.summary: Retries a failed order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to retry

post.summary: Pauses an order that is processing. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be paused.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to pause

post.summary: Puts the order into preview mode, where one can inspect what our labelers receive.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the preview.

post.summary: Resumes a paused order. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be resumed.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to resume

get.summary: Queries the clients for the current customer.
get.description:
A client allows a customer to authenticate with the APIs without using their own credentials.
This is useful for creating service accounts or other automated processes,
as when using the Rapidata Python SDK.

get.summary: Gets a specific client by its ID.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the client to retrieve.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The id of the client to delete.

post.summary: Creates a new client for the current customer.

requestBody.description: The model for creating a new client.

post.summary: Registers a new client dynamically.
post.description: The implementation of this method follows the OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration.

post.summary:
Creates a pair of read and write keys for a client.
The write key is used to store the authentication result.
The read key is used to retrieve the authentication result.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client ID to create the keys for.

get.summary:
Tries to read the bridge token keys for a given read key.
The read key is used to retrieve the authentication result written by the write key.

parameters.name: readKey
parameters.description: The read key to read the bridge token keys for.

post.summary: Sets the referrer for the current customer.
Signs in a user using a token received from Google One Tap.

requestBody.description: The body of the request containing the id token.

post.summary: Signs a user up to the newsletter.

requestBody.description: The model containing the email of a user and recaptcha token.

post.summary: Sends a survey.

get.summary: Retrieves information about the authenticated user.
Queries available validation sets based on the provided filter, paging and sorting criteria.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model containing the query parameters.

get.summary: Gets a validation set that is available to the user and best matches the provided parameters.
get.description: This is not a hard filter, instead it is used to find validation sets that have similar characteristics to the provided instruction.

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description:
The types of assets that the validation set should contain.
An asset type can be an image, video, audio, text, or any combination of these.
<para />
This parameter is a flag, meaning that it can be null or contain multiple values.
If multiple values are provided, a validation set will be chosen that contains at least one of the specified asset types.

parameters.name: modality
parameters.description:
The rapid modalities that the validation set should contain.
The modality is the type of rapid such as classify, compare, locate, etc.
<para />
This parameter is a flag, meaning that it can be null or contain multiple values.
If multiple values are provided, a validation set will be chosen that contains at least one of the specified modalities.

parameters.name: promptType
parameters.description:
The prompt types that the validation set should contain.
A prompt type is the additional information that is presented to the user when solving a rapid.
For example, a prompt type can be either text or an asset if the context is an image or video.
<para />
This parameter is a flag, meaning that it can be null or contain multiple values.
If multiple values are provided, a validation set will be chosen that contains at least one of the specified prompt types.

parameters.name: instruction
parameters.description:
An instruction that can be used to filter for validation sets that have similar instructions.
An instruction is a text that is presented to the user when solving a rapid that explains how to solve the rapid.

delete.summary: Gets a validation set by the id.

parameters.name: validationSetId
parameters.description: The id of the validation set to get.

get.summary: Gets a validation set by the id.

parameters.name: validationSetId
parameters.description: The id of the validation set to get.

patch.summary: Updates different characteristics of a validation set.

parameters.name: validationSetId
parameters.description: The Id of the validation set to update the dimensions for.

requestBody.description: The body request for updating the shouldAlert property.

get.summary: Gets the available validation sets for the current user.

post.summary: Creates a new empty validation set.

parameters.description: The validation set to add a rapid to.

post.summary: Refreshes the labeling hints for a validation set.
post.description: This will sample the rapids in the validation set and update the labeling hints based on the sampled rapids.

parameters.description: The id of the validation set to update the labeling hints for.

patch.summary: Updates the visibility of a validation set.
patch.description:
Public validation sets are used to automatically add a validation set to an order if no validation set is specified.
If the validation set is made public, the labeling hints will be updated automatically.

parameters.name: validationSetId
parameters.description: The id of the validation set to update the visibility for.

parameters.name: isPublic
parameters.description: Whether the validation set should be public or private.

get.summary:
Gets the limit most recent or oldest responses for a workflow.
The responses are not guaranteed to be of any specific rapid.
Instead, this endpoint returns all responses to any rapid in the workflow.

parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to get the responses for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of responses to get.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Whether the oldest or most recent responses should be returned.

parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to delete.

post.summary: Uploads a single asset to S3 and returns the asset details.
post.description:
This endpoint allows uploading a single file to S3 storage with the asset creator.
The uploaded asset will be stored using the configured S3 settings and a unique filename will be generated.

This endpoint allows uploading a single file to S3 storage with the asset creator.
The uploaded asset will be stored using the configured S3 settings and a unique filename will be generated.

client_id.description: The unique identifier for the client.

client_secret.description: The client secret for the client, which is used to authenticate the client

client_id_issued_at.description: The date and time when the client identifier was issued.

client_secret_expires_at.description:
If the client has a secret, this is the date and time when the client secret expires.
If the client secret does not expire, this will be 0.

redirect_uris.description:
Array of redirection URI strings for use in redirect-based flows
such as the authorization code and implicit flows.

grant_types.description: Array of OAuth 2.0 grant type strings that the client can use at the token endpoint.

response_types.description: Array of the OAuth 2.0 response type strings that the client can use at the authorization endpoint.

client_name.description: Human-readable string name of the client to be presented to the end-user during authorization.

client_uri.description: URL string of a web page providing information about the client.

logo_uri.description: URL string that references a logo for the client.

scope.description:
String containing a space-separated list of scope values
that the client can use when requesting access tokens.

contacts.description:
Array of strings representing ways to contact people responsible for this client,
typically email addresses.

tos_uri.description:
URL string that points to a human-readable terms of service document for the client that describes
a contractual relationship between the end-user and the client that the end-user
accepts when authorizing the client.

policy_uri.description:
URL string that points to a human-readable privacy policy document
that describes how the deployment organization collects,
uses, retains, and discloses personal data.

jwks_uri.description: URL string referencing the client's JSON Web Key document, which contains the client's public keys.

ClientModel.description:
The response containing the id and secret of a dynamically registered client.
Additionally, it contains all registered metadata for the client.

displayName.description: An optional display name for the client.

customerId.description: An optional customer ID to create the client for.

UpdateDimensionsModel.description: The model for updating the dimensions of all rapids within a validation set.

shouldAlert.description: A flag indicating whether the users should be alerted if they answer incorrectly.

UpdateShouldAlertModel.description: The model for updating the shouldAlert field of all rapids within a validation set.

UpdateValidationSetModel.description: Allows for specific updates to a validation set without needing to provide all properties.

key.description: The identifier of the demographic classification.

featureFlags.description: Optional feature flags to apply to the rapid.

asset.description: An optional asset to associate with the rapid.

context.description: An optional text context to show to the user.

contextAsset.description: An optional asset to use as context to show to the user.

CreateDemographicRapidModel.description: The model for creating a demographic rapid.

QueryValidationRapidEligibilityModel.Que.description: The Query Model specific to the validation rapid eligibility query.

sessionIndex.description: The index of the session when the result was submitted.

RapidResultModel.description: The model for a Rapid result.

rapidId.description: The ID of the Rapid that was skipped.

sessionIndex.description: The index of the session when the Rapid was skipped.

RapidSkippedModel.description: The model for a Rapid skipped.

message.description: An optional message typed by the user.

dump.description: A dump, that the frontend defines and can read again.

source.description: An optional identifier where the report originated from.

ReportModel.description: The model for reporting an issue with a rapid.

truth.description: The truth for the validation rapid.

explanation.description: The optional explanation that will be shown to the user when answering wrong.

prompt.description: The optional prompt that will be shown to the user.

context.description: An optional text context that will be shown to the user.

contextAsset.description: An optional asset that will be used as context to show to the user.

randomCorrectProbability.description: The probability that if the user answers at random that he'll be correct.

UpdateValidationRapidModel.description: The model for updating a validation rapid.

sortCriteria.description: A list of criteria to sort the results by.

GetCompareWorkflowResultsModel.description: Model for getting the overview of a compare workflow result.

states.description: An optional list of states to filter the rapids by.

sortCriteria.description: A list of criteria to sort the results by.

GetEvaluationWorkflowResultsModel.description: Model for getting the overview of a simple workflow result.

sortCriteria.description: A list of criteria to sort the results by.

GetGroupedRankingWorkflowResultsModel.description: Model for getting the results of a multi compare workflow.

states.description: An optional list of states to filter the rapids by.

sortCriteria.description: A list of criteria to sort the results by.

GetSimpleWorkflowResultsModel.description: Model for getting the overview of a simple workflow result.

sendEmail.description: Whether to email the user when the download is ready.

PreliminaryDownloadModel.description: The model for creating a preliminary download.

isManual.description: If the manual overwrite should be applied

isActive.description: If manual is set to true it will overrule the system with this.

ChangeBoostModel.description: The model to update the manual boost status. or putting it back to autopilot.

UpdateCampaignModel.description: The model to update campaign properties.

priority.description: The new priority value for the campaign.

UpdatePriorityModel.description: The model to update the campaign priority.

participants.description: The participants of the given leaderboard that should be boosted.

totalResponses.description: The amount of responses in total that should be added, shared across all participants.

BoostLeaderboardModel.description: The model for boosting a leaderboard.

CreateBenchmarkModel.description: The model for creating a benchmark.

CreateBenchmarkParticipantModel.description: The model to create a participant in a leaderboard

benchmarkId.description: If a leaderboard should be added to a preexisting benchmark, the benchmark Id can be provided.

benchmarkName.description:
If no BenchmarkId is provided a new benchmark will be created. if no name is supplied the benchmark
will be called the same as the leaderboard.

instruction.description: The instruction datapoints will be matched up against.

showPrompt.description: Indicates if the prompt is shown on the rapids.

showPromptAsset.description: Whether the prompt asset should be shown on the rapids.

responseBudget.description: Total amount of responses that get collected per run

minResponses.description: The minimum amount of responses that need to be collected per comparison.

isInversed.description: If the results should be inversed, meaning people should select the worse model.

validationSetId.description: The Validation set that should be attached to every run.

filters.description: The filters will be applied on every order that is created by this leaderboard.

featureFlags.description: Feature flags that will be applied to every order that is created by this leaderboard.

CreateLeaderboardModel.description: The CreateLeaderboardModel class represents the model for creating a leaderboard.

identifier.description: The identifier used to correlate samples of different participants.

asset.description: The asset input for the sample.

CreateSampleModel.description: The model used to create a sample to a participant.

identifier.description: An identifier associated to the prompt

tags.description: The tags of a given prompt

SubmitPromptModel.description: The model user for submitting a prompt to a benchmark.

UpdateBenchmarkModel.description: The model used to update a benchmark.

name.description: The new name of the benchmark.

UpdateBenchmarkNameModel.description: The model used to update the name of a benchmark.

UpdateLeaderboardModel.description: The model used to update a leaderboard.

name.description: The new name of the leaderboard.

UpdateLeaderboardNameModel.description: The model used to update the name of a leaderboard.

responseBudget.description: The amount of responses that will be collected when onboarding a new participant.

minResponses.description: The amount of responses that will be collected as a minimum on each matchup.

UpdateLeaderboardResponseConfigModel.description: The model used to update the name of a leaderboard.

UpdateParticipantModel.description: The model used to update a participant.

name.description: The new name of the participant.

UpdateParticipantNameModel.description: The model used to update the name of a participant.

tags.description: The list of tags to be associated with the prompt.

UpdatePromptTagsModel.description: The model for updating prompt tags.

bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}"
bearer.name: Authorization

oauth2.description: OAuth2 authorization code flow, supporting OpenID Connect.
